Saving same verbosity is nice, but the downsides are now having a macro that obscures what's happening, and is applied inconsistently throughout configure; less than half of our `AX_CHECK_COMPILE_FLAG` calls are replaced with it.\n\nThis approach would also not work with the change currently proposed in #18882 (we'd end up with duplicate `-Wformat` flags). > @fanquake, what's your take on this, now that #18882 has been merged?\n\nMy take is still the same as [my comment above](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18857#issuecomment-623902841). I'm not convinced introducing an inconsistently used macro, to essentially save some line length, is a huge win. In general I prefer that we are explicit/verbose when it comes to anything build system rel

<sub>Want to unsubscribe from rebase notifications on this pull request? Just convert this pull request to a "draft".</sub>

Closing this because it needs frequent rebasing and it is not moving anywhere.

It has 4 "Concept ACK" and 1 "Concept ~0".

The point of this PR is to save repetitions, not line length. The introduced macro is not used everywhere (to replace `AX_CHECK_COMPILE_FLAG`), but on the places where it is used the usage is consistent.

If there is interest in this, I would be happy to reopen an

I tend to agree with @fanquake:
> In general I prefer that we are explicit/verbose when it comes to anything build system related.
Could also define `SET_FLAG_IF_AVAILABLE` and use throughout.

That would be a little bit less straight forward. While such code would definitely benefit from it:
```
AX_CHECK_COMPILE_FLAG([-msse4.2],[[SSE42_CXXFLAGS="-msse4.2"]],,[[$CXXFLAG_WERROR]])
```
and become:
```
SET_FLAG_IF_AVAILABLE([SSE42_CXXFLAGS], [-msse4.2])
```
there are other usages where the code calls `AC_MSG_ERROR()` if the flag is not available or does not compile with an a
Yeah didn't check if all follow the same pattern. Separate PR is fine.
